trans-unit.source: Protect app data using MAM policies | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Protect app data using MAM policies | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: This topic explains how mobile app management policies can help protect your company data, prevent data loss, and keep personal and work information separate.
trans-unit.target: This topic explains how mobile app management policies can help protect your company data, prevent data loss, and keep personal and work information separate.

trans-unit.source: Protect app data using mobile app management policies with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Protect app data using mobile app management policies with Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: How you can protect app data
trans-unit.target: How you can protect app data

trans-unit.source: Your employees use mobile devices for both personal and work tasks.
trans-unit.target: Your employees use mobile devices for both personal and work tasks.

trans-unit.source: While making sure your employees can be productive, you also want to prevent data loss, intentional and unintentional.
trans-unit.target: While making sure your employees can be productive, you also want to prevent data loss, intentional and unintentional.

trans-unit.source: In addition, you want to have the ability to protect company data accessed using devices even in the case where they are not managed by you.
trans-unit.target: In addition, you want to have the ability to protect company data accessed using devices even in the case where they are not managed by you.

trans-unit.source: You can use Intune mobile app management (MAM) policies to help protect your company’s data.
trans-unit.target: You can use Intune mobile app management (MAM) policies to help protect your company’s data.

trans-unit.source: Because Intune MAM policies can be used **independent of any mobile-device management (MDM) solution**, you can use it to protect your company’s data with or without enrolling devices in a device management solution.
trans-unit.target: Because Intune MAM policies can be used **independent of any mobile-device management (MDM) solution**, you can use it to protect your company’s data with or without enrolling devices in a device management solution.

trans-unit.source: By implementing **app-level policies**, you can restrict access to company resources and keep data within the purview of your IT department.
trans-unit.target: By implementing **app-level policies**, you can restrict access to company resources and keep data within the purview of your IT department.

trans-unit.source: MAM policies can be configured for app running on devices that are:
trans-unit.target: MAM policies can be configured for app running on devices that are:

trans-unit.source: **Enrolled in Microsoft Intune:** The devices in this category are typically corporate owned devices.
trans-unit.target: **Enrolled in Microsoft Intune:** The devices in this category are typically corporate owned devices.

trans-unit.source: **Enrolled in a third-party Mobile device management (MDM) solution:** The devices in this category are typically corporate owned devices.
trans-unit.target: **Enrolled in a third-party Mobile device management (MDM) solution:** The devices in this category are typically corporate owned devices.

trans-unit.source: Mobile app management policies should not be used with third party mobile app management or secure container solutions.
trans-unit.target: Mobile app management policies should not be used with third party mobile app management or secure container solutions.

trans-unit.source: **Not enrolled in any mobile device management solution:** The devices in this category are typically employee owned devices that are not managed or enrolled in Intune or other MDM solutions.
trans-unit.target: **Not enrolled in any mobile device management solution:** The devices in this category are typically employee owned devices that are not managed or enrolled in Intune or other MDM solutions.

trans-unit.source: You can create mobile app management policies for Office mobile apps that connect to Office 365 services.
trans-unit.target: You can create mobile app management policies for Office mobile apps that connect to Office 365 services.

trans-unit.source: MAM policies are not supported for apps that connect to on-premises Exchange, Skype for Business, or SharePoint services.
trans-unit.target: MAM policies are not supported for apps that connect to on-premises Exchange, Skype for Business, or SharePoint services.

trans-unit.source: **The important benefits of using MAM policies are**
trans-unit.target: **The important benefits of using MAM policies are**

trans-unit.source: Protecting your company data at the app level.
trans-unit.target: Protecting your company data at the app level.

trans-unit.source: Since mobile app management does not require device management, you can protect company data on both managed and unmanaged devices.
trans-unit.target: Since mobile app management does not require device management, you can protect company data on both managed and unmanaged devices.

trans-unit.source: The management is centered on the user identity, which removes the requirement for device management.
trans-unit.target: The management is centered on the user identity, which removes the requirement for device management.

trans-unit.source: End user productivity is not impacted, and the policies are not applied when using the app in a personal context.
trans-unit.target: End user productivity is not impacted, and the policies are not applied when using the app in a personal context.

trans-unit.source: The policies are applied only in a work context, thus giving you the ability to protect company data without touching personal data.
trans-unit.target: The policies are applied only in a work context, thus giving you the ability to protect company data without touching personal data.

trans-unit.source: There are additional benefits to using MDM with MAM policies, and companies can use both MAM with and without MDM at the same time.
trans-unit.target: There are additional benefits to using MDM with MAM policies, and companies can use both MAM with and without MDM at the same time.

trans-unit.source: For example, an employee may use a phone issued by the company as well as a personal tablet.
trans-unit.target: For example, an employee may use a phone issued by the company as well as a personal tablet.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the company phone is enrolled in MDM and protected by MAM policies, and the personal device is protected by MAM policies only.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the company phone is enrolled in MDM and protected by MAM policies, and the personal device is protected by MAM policies only.

trans-unit.source: **MDM makes sure that the device is protected**.
trans-unit.target: **MDM makes sure that the device is protected**.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can require a PIN to access the device, or you can deploy managed apps to the device.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can require a PIN to access the device, or you can deploy managed apps to the device.

trans-unit.source: You can also deploy apps to devices through your MDM solution, to give you more control over app management.
trans-unit.target: You can also deploy apps to devices through your MDM solution, to give you more control over app management.

trans-unit.source: **MAM policies makes sure that the app-layer protections are in place**.
trans-unit.target: **MAM policies makes sure that the app-layer protections are in place**.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can require a PIN to open an app in a work context, or if data can be shared between apps, or preventing company app data from being saved to a personal storage location.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can require a PIN to open an app in a work context, or if data can be shared between apps, or preventing company app data from being saved to a personal storage location.

trans-unit.source: MAM polices are currently supported on:
trans-unit.target: MAM polices are currently supported on:

trans-unit.source: iOS 8.1 or later
trans-unit.target: iOS 8.1 or later

trans-unit.source: Android 4 or later
trans-unit.target: Android 4 or later

trans-unit.source: Windows devices are currently not supported.
trans-unit.target: Windows devices are currently not supported.

trans-unit.source: Multi-identity
trans-unit.target: Multi-identity

trans-unit.source: Apps that support multi-identity gives you the ability to use different accounts - work and personal, to access the same apps while MAM policies are applied on when the apps are used in the work context.
trans-unit.target: Apps that support multi-identity gives you the ability to use different accounts - work and personal, to access the same apps while MAM policies are applied on when the apps are used in the work context.

trans-unit.source: For example, when the end user launches the OneDrive app using their work account, they cannot move the files to a personal storage location.
trans-unit.target: For example, when the end user launches the OneDrive app using their work account, they cannot move the files to a personal storage location.

trans-unit.source: However, when the end user uses OneDrive with their personal account, they can copy and move data from their personal OneDrive without restrictions.
trans-unit.target: However, when the end user uses OneDrive with their personal account, they can copy and move data from their personal OneDrive without restrictions.

trans-unit.source: For a detailed explanation of the experience of using apps that are associated with MAM policies, and how apps with Multi-identity support enable applying MAM policies only in work context, read [using apps with multi-identity support](end-user-experience-for-mam-enabled-apps-with-microsoft-intune.md#using-apps-with-multi-identity-support)
trans-unit.target: For a detailed explanation of the experience of using apps that are associated with MAM policies, and how apps with Multi-identity support enable applying MAM policies only in work context, read [using apps with multi-identity support](end-user-experience-for-mam-enabled-apps-with-microsoft-intune.md#using-apps-with-multi-identity-support)

trans-unit.target: All Office mobile apps support multi-identity.
